ARABIC: إِنَّا سَخَّرْنَا ٱلْجِبَالَ مَعَهُۥ يُسَبِّحْنَ بِٱلْعَشِىِّ وَٱلْإِشْرَاقِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We subjected the mountains to glorify with him in the evening and at sunrise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We subjugated the chiefs (of tribes) to struggle day and night with him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: With him We had subjected the mountains that they join him in celebrating Allah's glory, evening and morning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We made the mountains join him in glorifying Us in the evening and in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed We subjected the hills to say the praise with him, at night and at morn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, We made the mountains to glorify Our praises with him in the `Ashi and Ishraq.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely We made the mountains to sing the glory (of Allah) in unison with him at the evening and the sunrise,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: With him We subjected the mountains to give glory at evening and sunrise,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! We subdued the hills to hymn the praises (of their Lord) with him at nightfall and sunrise,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We made the mountains join him in glorifying Us at sunset and sunrise;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily We so subjected the mountains that they should hallow Us with him at nightfall and sunrise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: We disposed the mountains to glorify [Allah] with him at evening and dawn,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: It was We that made the hills declare, in unison with him, Our Praises, at eventide and at break of day,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, We made the mountains to glorify Our Praises with him [Dawud (David)] in the 'Ashi (i.e. after the mid-day till sunset) and Ishraq (i.e. after the sunrise till mid-day).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We subjected the mountains to exalt (Me) with him in the evening and at sunrise,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We committed the mountains to glorify with him, in the evening and at daybreak.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, We subjected the mountains [to praise] with him, exalting [Allah] in the [late] afternoon and [after] sunrise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [38:18] Truly We disposed the mountains to glorify [God] with him, with the same glorification, at evening, at the time of the night prayer, and at sunrise, at the time of the morning prayer, which is when the sun has fully risen with its light extending everywhere.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! We subdued) We made subservient (the hills to hymn) with him (the praises (of their Lord) with him at nightfall and sunrise) in the morning and evening,
